alert.note: Alert for Carver; Scott; Sibley (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 18 at 10:15AM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River near Jordan affecting Scott, Sibley and Carver Counties. .The combination of spring snowmelt and upcoming rainfall will continue to cause very high river levels on the Minnesota River through the coming week. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River near Jordan. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 26.7 feet, The bridge at Scott County Road 9 and Carver County Road 11/Jonathan Carver Parkway will be closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 945 AM CDT Tuesday, the stage was 23.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening and continue rising to 26.7 feet early Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.6 feet on 07/04/2010. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
